title: (x) Target summer campaign script font - Cocktail Shaker {Chesh}
content: okay i know i'm really bad about not posting a sample and all, but i figgered that anyone in the US who gets a newspaper would have seen this the past couple weeks. If you know what i'm talking about and know the name of the font, lemme know. If no one else got the flyer, i'll try to post a sample tomorrow.
author: pablohoney77

comments.content:
If the attached image is an example of what you're looking for, it's Stuart Sandler's [Cocktail Shaker](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130228/http:/www.chank.com/font_detail.php?sku=5388), though it's over at Chank's house.   
   
 ![summer](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130228im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/37884.gif)
It's a beaut, I must add.
that's the one! i remember seeing it at chank now that you say that. and i shoulda known it was one of stuarts, but couldn't find it on his sight. guess that threw me for a loop.

I knew I'd seen it before, too, but for me, at least, it took browsing through Mike Yanega's site to find it. When I saw it, I knew it was Stuart's, but then I couldn't find it on his site, then had to search Google, where I finally found it on Chank's. Interestingly, it's not even listed in the Chank A-Z catalog, but its own page is still there on the site.   
   
Stu? Chank? Anyone have any insights on this?
\> Stu, if yer reading, you should have someplace on yer site that showcases fonts you've done that are available from different sources. Good idea? no? \>
